column4: is there some place where I can download a header called process.h?
So, $ should be replaced with the name of the header I'm looking for?
the command is to be executed as is
I found the source code for a file called process.h online.  Aside from the risk of malicious code, could I just put this in my include directory as-is?
well a *.h without the corresponding c code or lib is mostly useless (you neeed the implementation too)
what is supposed to offer the *.h file?
No chance that the program I'm trying to compile has the implementation?
Also Digital Mars, GNU Common C++, and there's a wikipedia article about it
what are you trying to compile?
It's a dock app for *box (yes I have fluxbox installed) that measures my battery capacity.  bbacpi
So.... think it might?  And since it's all just abstract functions, there's a good chance it can't actually do anything bad to my comp unless something implements it to do so, right?
i guess so but can not tell for sure
I see.  Well if it doesn't work, then I haven't really lost anything except time, which I have an abundance of, so I'll try downloading it.
